info.author: Simeon Warner
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License
info.description:
pb - Python with braces (duck) for easy one-liners
==================================================

As an old Perl-hack I really miss the convenience of one-line programs where
I can easily add block structure. This script emulates the behaviors of 
`perl -e`, `perl -n` and `perl -p` using braces (`{` and `}`) to generate 
Pythonesque indentation. There may be other ways to get around this but 
the goal is to make one-liners as easy as we expect.

Examples:

```
>./pb 'for j in range(1,10) { for k in range(0,j) { sys.stdout.write(".") } sys.stdout.write("\n") }'
.
..
...
....
.....
......
.......
........
.........
```

PS. I know this one is very easy as a true Python one-liner:


```
>python -c 'print "\n".join("."*j for j in range (1,10))'
.
..
...
....
.....
......
.......
........
.........
```
info.name: pb
info.summary: Python with braces for easy one-liners
